update.description:
Issue #391

I thought of making a pull request for each item, but the code is very similar so I don't think it will be too complicated to review it all at once. In any case, each of the 3 commits should have all the changes relative to the respective item:

* 19d2d50: Wall segment color on wall segment inspector

* 0d0eee5: Stairs color on stairs inspector

* 728900a: Floor color on level inspector

Example preview and saved model:
![colors3.png](https://bitbucket.org/repo/jgXqbo/images/4117822154-colors3.png)

content.raw:
Aha, so it probably works for the stairs because they have nested visuals, and for the walls there might be something like this left over which I overlooked when migrating from polylines.

Cool, will make sure I come back to this later.
content.html:
Aha, so it probably works for the stairs because they have nested visuals, and for the walls there might be something like this left over which I overlooked when migrating from polylines.

Cool, will make sure I come back to this later.

content.raw:
mm looking at [Visual::SetAmbient](#!/osrf/gazebo/src/32a0757e27ff207ed85db0f766d189ed31d29f8f/gazebo/rendering/Visual.cc), there is a bug that calls `SetSpecular` on of the child visuals so I am guessing that's why it worked.. 

I've ticketed issue #1343, and once that's fixed we can come back and fix this afterwards.
content.html:
mm looking at Visual::SetAmbient, there is a bug that calls SetSpecular on of the child visuals so I am guessing that's why it worked..

I've ticketed issue #1343, and once that's fixed we can come back and fix this afterwards.

pull_request.title: Building Editor: Pick wall / floor / stairs color from a pre-set list on inspector

pullrequest.title: Building Editor: Pick wall / floor / stairs color from a pre-set list on inspector

content.raw:
Hi Ian, is it very important that it be diffuse instead of ambient? 

I've been trying all day and I have no idea why simply changing this like to `SetDiffuse` makes the floor not transparent anymore. Only the floor, walls and stairs work fine...

By the way, setting only diffuse here and on `BuildingMaker`, the resulting building is much darker. I wonder if we should do some sort of mix...
content.html:
Hi Ian, is it very important that it be diffuse instead of ambient?

I've been trying all day and I have no idea why simply changing this like to SetDiffuse makes the floor not transparent anymore. Only the floor, walls and stairs work fine...

By the way, setting only diffuse here and on BuildingMaker, the resulting building is much darker. I wonder if we should do some sort of mix...

content.raw:
I think I tried to do this, but I ran into the problem that maps only work one-way, and I'm using it two-ways... Sometimes I have the `QColor` and want the `index`, sometimes I have the `index` and want the `QColor`. 

The only solution I found was to create 2 structures, one for each situation. Do you think it's worth it? Is there another way?
content.html:
I think I tried to do this, but I ran into the problem that maps only work one-way, and I'm using it two-ways... Sometimes I have the QColor and want the index, sometimes I have the index and want the QColor.

The only solution I found was to create 2 structures, one for each situation. Do you think it's worth it? Is there another way?
